intro: Verbena canadensis, commonly known as Canadian verbena, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species that typically grows up to 1 meter in height. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Verbena canadensis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
